cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Name: Smart Building Services
cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Description:
The Contracting Entity intends to procure a framework agreement for the provision of Smart Building and Lighting controls. The purpose is to source an integrator to design, supply, install and commission smart lighting and smart building control retrofits. This smart building control solution must be capable to integrate multiple standalone technologies into a smart controlled solution.
Lot 1: Smart lighting solution to include design, installation, Commissioning, Operation and Maintenance Lot 2: Smart building integration solution to include design, installation, Commissioning & Operation and Maintenance Lot 3: Building metering design & integration solution to include design, installation, Commissioning & Operation and Maintenance

efac:SelectionCriteria.cbc:Description: Selection criteria are defined in the PQQ document Information about the second stage of a two ­stage procedure: The procedure will take place in successive stages. At each stage, some participants may be eliminated

cac:PaymentTerms.cbc:Note: Information to be provided to shortlisted applicants at the RFT stage

cac:ContractExecutionRequirement.cbc:Description: To be detailed to selected applicants at RFT stage

cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Name: Lot 2 Smart building integration solution to include design, installation, Commissioning & Operation and Maintenance
cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Description:
A smart building control solution must be capable to integrate multiple standalone technologies into a smart controlled solution. Standalone technologies include but are not limited to: • Existing and new Lighting fittings • Heat pumps • Boilers • Chillers • Cooling towers • Solar Photovoltaic (Solar PV) solutions • Demand Response • Load Management to meet Maximum Import Capacity (MIC) requirements.
The technologies must be centrally controlled and work in conjunction alongside each other in an innovative manner that maximises efficiency within the building or facility.
It is envisaged that successful applicants will be responsible for the design, supply, installation, and commissioning of the smart building integration solution. The points below shall be satisfied.
• The Contractor must be capable of: o Performing a technical onsite assessment when a project is initiated and thereafter; o Optimising an existing Building Management System (BMS) and integrate other building systems such as lighting & Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) controls; o Providing metering and tracking for building resources such as electricity, water, and gas; o Providing a centralised intelligent/smart Building Management System or Platform, in the absence of an existing BMS. The system or platform shall have cloud-based functionalities including but not limited to leveraging cloud data analytics capabilities; o Providing a solution that’s secured, future-proof and based on open communication protocols;
• Supply, installation, and commissioning of all the controls and sensors devices required to transform a building into a smart building, subject to ESB Smart Energy Services (SES) or customer’s needs; • The Contractor must have a warranty for parts (replacement) and labour in place for the duration of the contract; • Testing & commissioning of the smart building solution.
Desirable functions of the centralised intelligent/smart Building Management System or Platform: • Carbon emissions reporting • Work Order management system • Digital Twinning building Solution • Fault detection and Predictive Maintenance • Space and resource utilisation
Framework members for this lot will be required to provide other related products and services as need by the Contracting Entity
